oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Theoretical investigation of C–H···H–B dihydrogen bonded complexes of acetylenes with borane-trimethylamine
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, PRASHANT CHANDRA
PATWARI, GNARESH
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hydrogen bonds
fluorine
amines
charge transfer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Formation of C–H···H–B dihydrogen bonded complexes of acetylene, fluoroacetylene, chloroacetylene, and cyanoacetylene with borane-trimethylamine were investigated with MP2 and B3LYP methods using 6-311++G(d,p) and aug-cc-pVDZ basis sets. The stabilization energies ranged from 6–20 kJ mol−1. NBO analysis predicts transfer of charge from σ B–H bonding orbital to σ* C–H anti-bonding orbital. It was also found that the lowering of the C–H stretching frequencies of acetylene moiety in the dihydrogen bonded complex does not correlate with other hydrogen bonded complexes, indicating that the supposition of dihydrogen bonding as another type of hydrogen bonding (σ and π) may be incorrect.
